Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameLogic
  • public final class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the orchestrator and it interacts with all the other classes and combines them into a playable game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.List<java.lang.String> botCommands
      List of strings that contain all the valid bot commands
      private int currentPlayerIndex
      Integer representing which index in the ArrayList of playerArray is the current player in (the player who's turn it is)
      private boolean gameRunning
      Boolean representing whether the game is running or not.
      private int gold
      This is initialised in game rather than in human as my game allows for multiple humans / bots to play, so humans collect gold as a team
      private java.util.List<java.lang.String> humanCommands
      List of strings that contain all the valid human commands
      private Map map
      Represents the map of the game
      private int numberOfBots
      Stores the number of bots in the game
      private int numberOfHumans
      Stores the number of humans in the game
      private java.util.ArrayList<Player> playerArray
      Arraylist that stores all players so we can loop over them
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Command> validCommands
      represents a Mapping between all the command names and the corresponding commands created

      • init

        Initialises the game

        private Player getPlayer​(int index)
        Gets the player given the player index
        Parameters:
        index - player index in PlayerArray
        Returns:
        object of type Player representing a player.

      • hello

        private java.lang.String hello​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
        This is one of the functions that a human player can call. Receives a list of arguments (which is length 0) and returns how much gold is required to leave with win.
        Parameters:
        args - an empty list of Strings.
        Returns:
        String saying how much gold is required to leave with win.

      • gold

        private java.lang.String gold​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
        This is one of the functions that a human player can call. Receives a list of arguments (which is length 0) and returns how much gold the players have collaboratively.
        Parameters:
        args - an empty list of Strings.
        Returns:
        String saying how much gold the players have collaboratively.

      • move

        private java.lang.String move​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
        Receives a list of arguments (of length 1) and tries to move the player in the corresponding direction they asked
        Parameters:
        args - List of strings containing the direction the user wants to move in
        Returns:
        String which is "Success" or "Fail" based on whether the move was successful or not.

      • coordTile

        private char coordTile​(Coordinate vector)
        Returns the tile in position (x,y) that should be displayed to the bot/player.
        Parameters:
        vector - Coordinate representing the position of the tile to get
        Returns:
        character representing the character that should be displayed to the bot/player in position (x,y)

      • look

        private java.lang.String look​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
        Builds a square of size lookRange around the player (i.e. player being centralised) and returning it
        Parameters:
        args - an empty list of Strings.
        Returns:
        String representing the cropped map around the current player

      • pickup

        private java.lang.String pickup​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
        Tries to pick up gold by checking if current player is on a gold tile. returns an appropriate message.
        Parameters:
        args - an empty list of Strings.
        Returns:
        String describing whether action was successful or not and the current gold owned.

      • quitGame

        private java.lang.String quitGame​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
        Ends the game, and displays whether the humans or bots won (from human prospective).
        Parameters:
        args - an empty list of Strings.
        Returns:
        String describing whether the humans won or lost.

      • commandInitialiser

        private void commandInitialiser​(java.lang.String commandName,
                                java.util.Set<java.lang.String> validArgs,
                                int minArgNum,
                                int maxArgNum,
                                java.util.function.Function<java.util.List<java.lang.String>,​java.lang.String> functionPointer)
        Initialises a command object of type Command and stores it in the validCommands HashMap with the key commandName.
        Parameters:
        commandName - String representing the command user should enter to call this command
        validArgs - Set representing the valid arguments the command receives.
        minArgNum - Minimum number of arguments the command is allowed to receive.
        maxArgNum - Maximum number of arguments the command is allowed to receive.
        functionPointer - A method reference representing which function should be called.

      • createCommands

        private void createCommands()
        Creates all the commands by calling commandInitialiser for each command to the command with the corresponding arguments.

      • createPlayer

        private void createPlayer​(boolean human,
                          java.util.ArrayList<Command> validCommandsArray)
        Creates a player by assigning it random coordinates and a commands array that is accepts.
        Parameters:
        human - boolean representing whether the player is human or not
        validCommandsArray - Arraylist of commands storing the valid commands the player can use

      • createPlayers

        private void createPlayers()
        This function creates humans and bots depending on how many players are requested

      • update

        private java.lang.String update()
        Executes a turn for the current player, returning a message (corresponding with whether move was executed correctly) to its caller.
        Returns:
        String representing the current player's DoD response

      • loadMap

        private void loadMap()
        Loads in the default map.

      • botsWin

        private boolean botsWin()
        Checks to see whether there exists a bot that is on the same tile as a human player, if so, then the bots win.
        Returns:
        boolean representing whether the bots won or not

      • loopTurn

        public java.lang.String loopTurn​(java.lang.String userInput)
        Loops the game until either the bots won or its a players turn.
        Parameters:
        userInput - String representing the user's input
        Returns:
        String representing what should be displayed to the user

      • validateHumanAndBotNum

        private void validateHumanAndBotNum​(int numberOfHumans,
                                    int numberOfBots)
        Checks if the number of humans and number of bots are valid
        Parameters:
        numberOfHumans - integer representing how many human players in the game
        numberOfBots - integer representing how many bot players in the game

      • getGameRunning

        public boolean getGameRunning()
        Getter for the gameRunning boolean variable
        Returns:
        boolean representing whether the game is running or not.
